Description: Statuette of a ba-bird: a statuette in opaque red glass, matt surface, of a ba-bird standing on a base. The composition is entirely traditional with the bird standing frontal and wearing a short headdress. Cross-hatching on wings and tail. The details of the face and striations of the wig were added after moulding. Relatively crude work but a rare type in glass. A large gap on the back where the two wings meet is a moulding defect.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Pinch, Magic in Ancient Egypt (London 1994), p.142, fig.78 (misnumbered EA 6431).
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
